pros: Lots of time off.  I was "seasonal" meaning I didn't work summers.  In addition, two weeks off for Christmas.   Benefits are really good, too.
cons: OMG. Where to start.....the inmates are running the asylum.  Just about every person in a management position was NOT qualified for their job.  As a result WATCH YOUR BACK!  Wesley is one of the worst institutions for throwing around blame.  Nothing is ever resolved.  In addition, the college is really going down the drain (Class of 2017 graduating class was only 242 students.  Registration last semester was at an all time low.). As a result, no pay raise, very low salary to begin with, money is very tight (we were not allowed to order office supplies.). Terrible management.  It's a shame but probably one of the worst places I've ever worked.

pros:
Great work life balance- I teach class, have office hours, and leave. No one questions me about it because everyone else does the same thing.

Some faculty are absolutely incredible colleagues to work with, and it is truly enjoyable to work with them.
cons:
The college is really struggling financially, and it's a dark outlook. No salary increases. Benefits are constantly being slashed.

Administration is incredibly unprofessional and have done several shady things. Junior faculty are terrified of getting their jobs cut, as has happened to several I know. Morale is low and it's not a positive environment. A few faculty have appointed themselves in positions of power and are abusing it. Administration continually sweeps problems under the rug.

review_title: I loved it. I was the receptionist and cashier. I also helped out with the older residents.

cons: sometimes the cna's  would be running behind with their schedules at closing time.
